messages.subject: I strew some for myself
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/30/02 12:11:07 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/30/02 12:11:07 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< We went to a Pick Your Own berry patch this morning. I have never in my
life been berry picking and we had such a ball. The warm early morning
sunshine, feeling the mud on your feet from last night's rain, the kids
giggling and running around, the black and red berries and the juice on your
fingers when you pull too hard, Danny eating handful after handful, funny
faces when the kids would get a sour one. >>

Aaaah, thanks for the warm, fuzzy memories of Oregon.
I have GOT to go berry picking soon. I can still see my little three y.o.
Trevor, just done picking Strawberries, sitting on the kitchen counter with
juice and dirt all running down his chin and a big, goofy smile on his face.
Sigh....
Ren

messages.subject: I strew some for myself
messages.msgSnippet: We went to a Pick Your Own berry patch this morning.  I have never in my life been berry picking and we had such a ball.  The warm early morning sunshine,
messages.messageBody:
We went to a Pick Your Own berry patch this morning. I have never in my
life been berry picking and we had such a ball. The warm early morning
sunshine, feeling the mud on your feet from last night's rain, the kids
giggling and running around, the black and red berries and the juice on your
fingers when you pull too hard, Danny eating handful after handful, funny
faces when the kids would get a sour one.

What a wonderful morning.

Julie---with many pies to make :)
